displayName.text: Four Points by Sheraton Chennai OMR

places.shortFormattedAddress: No 169 Plot 1B, Four Points 1, Survey, 1A, Rajiv Gandhi Salai, Kumaran Nagar, Sholinganallur, Chennai

editorialSummary.text: Relaxed quarters in a modern hotel featuring dining, an outdoor pool & a fitness centre.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Four Points by Sheraton, booked under a Superior Twin Bed Room by my clients, and the overall experience was very pleasant. The check-in process was smooth and quick, which is always a relief after a long journey.

The room was quite spacious for a business hotel in this range — easily comfortable for two people. It also had a neat little work area, which made catching up on emails and tasks easy and convenient. The beds and sofas were very comfy, perfect for both relaxing and getting some work done.

What stood out was the buffet spread — a good variety of dishes across cuisines, and everything we tried tasted great. It’s definitely one of the highlights if you enjoy hotel dining.

The location is another big plus. Situated on the OMR and near Taramani, it’s ideal if you have meetings or work around this part of Chennai. The views from the room were lovely too, adding a touch of calm to the business vibe.

All in all, Four Points by Sheraton ticks all the boxes for a comfortable, convenient stay — especially for work-related travel. I’d definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the area for business.

text.text:
I had a wonderful stay at this hotel during my visit to Chennai. From the moment I arrived, the front desk staff made me feel welcome with their warm hospitality and professionalism. The check-in process was smooth and efficient, which set the tone for the rest of my stay. Ankita was exceptional

The room was clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, with all the amenities I needed thanks to Rahul. The room service was excellent — prompt, courteous, and the food arrived hot and fresh every time.

One of the highlights of my stay was the hotel’s restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious, offering a great variety of local and international dishes, all beautifully presented. The ambiance was lovely, and the staff were attentive without being intrusive. Special thanks to Ankit kumar jha  and debashish bakshi

Overall, this hotel exceeded my expectations. I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Chennai, whether for business or leisure. Looking forward to staying here again!

We stayed at the property for almost 7 days while traveling with our two kids, and weren’t quite sure what to expect. But the team at Four Points by Sheraton made us feel completely at home.

Special thanks to Samar and the team at The Eatery for their professionalism and seamless management of the buffet. Ankita and the front office team were incredibly helpful and accommodating with all our requests. A big shoutout to the housekeeping staff as well for maintaining our room in spotless condition every single day.

Highly recommended property – we’d definitely love to come back!

text.text:
First time staying at the hotel for 3 nights.
Breakfast is decent and has almost all varieties. Dosa and filter coffee quality are bad though, that too in Chennai.
They must serve freshly squeezed juice, the ones kept on the counter are watery and stale.
Service and staff both were great and we felt comfortable during our stay.
We stayed at the king bedroom and it was spacious and well designed.
Lounge can be improved much, only one veg and nonveg starter are kept along with a salad, veg sandwich and assorted pastries. They have converted a small recreation area next to the bar as the lounge.
Location is on the main road and it's closer to many eateries.

text.text:
We chose this hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary, hoping for a special and memorable experience. Unfortunately, it turned out to be bit disappointing. Upon arrival, we saw the room was far too small and the bed was nowhere near what one would expect for a superior queen size bed. While we appreciated that the staff did arrange some decorations adviced by wife however the overall size and condition of the room felt misleading and underwhelming.

We booked "Superior Queen Room" for three days. Room felt congested and claustrophobic. AC was too slow we were sweating. The bathroom smell like someone smoked for really long time. Even after room freshener it didn't went. After celebrating our disappointing anniversary in the room. We found difficult to sleep on the small bed.

Eventually we had to upgrade the room on the second day, but even that didn’t improve much. The air conditioning was working way too slow, and cleanliness was clearly not a priority. There were few stains on the sofa, bathroom was not cleaned properly. Bed was king but the sheet was for Queen. It was not tucking properly. Had to call room service to fix the bed everytime.

The food was average, serving similar food almost everyday. One morning I took few fruits but it was rotten it had smell. Although they changed immediately but it was there job to check the quality. The most shocking moment came on our last day when my wife saw a cockroach on a buffet plate – I had to personally inform a staff member to remove it. This could have cost life if the cockroaches are on the buffet plate.

Although a few staff members were polite and tried their best, the overall experience was unacceptable. What should have been a joyful anniversary celebration ended up disappointing. For the amount what my wife paid for the suprise especially for the decoration and room upgrade, the service and quality were nowhere close to the expectations. Sadly, I would not return or recommend this place to anyone.

text.text:
My stay at Citadines OMR Chennai was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment I checked in, I was impressed by the warm hospitality and professionalism of the staff. The rooms are spacious, modern, and spotlessly clean every detail is thoughtfully designed for comfort and convenience.

The food was a true highlight every meal was fresh, flavourful, and beautifully presented. The breakfast buffet offered an excellent spread, catering to both Indian and continental tastes.

The hotel’s amenities are top-notch a well-equipped gym, a serene swimming pool, and cozy lounge areas that make you feel at home. The location is also perfect, right on OMR and well connected to the city’s business hubs and shopping areas.

Citadines truly sets a high standard in hospitality. Whether you’re here for business or leisure, this place offers a luxurious yet homely experience. Highly recommended without a second thought!

places.shortFormattedAddress: Somerset Greenways, 94, Sathyadev Ave, MRC Nagar, Raja Annamalai Puram, Chennai

editorialSummary.text: Polished units in an upmarket apartment hotel offering a rooftop infinity pool, a terrace & dining.

text.text:
Disappointment and a ruined evening — we do not recommend this hotel

This hotel turned out to be a major disappointment. The nightly rate is even higher than that of the famous The Leela Palace, which naturally sets certain expectations. Unfortunately, the reality was far from what was promised.

Upon arrival, we immediately noticed that the room provided did not match the photos shown on the booking platform. For a price of over 30,000 rupees per night, this is simply unacceptable. The room was half the size advertised, and somehow ended up being twice as expensive. Despite having a confirmed reservation, no suitable alternative was offered.

The service was extremely poor: no valet, very slow response times, and untrained staff who were unable to explain the situation clearly. As a result, we were left without a place to stay late at night, with a child, forced to search for another hotel on our own.

It’s truly unfortunate that a hotel charging such high rates fails to meet even the basic standards of service. We do not recommend staying here if you value comfort, transparency, and respectful treatment.

text.text: I recently stayed at the Somerset greenways in MRC nagar with my family for 10 days. I cannot praise the staff enough for making our stay very peaceful and worry-free. Right from the security staff who took excellent care for my octogenarian dad, and room service that delivered piping hot coffee to our rooms and the excellent brunch service at the broken bridge cafe, this was a 5 star experience for us. We entertained extended family with dinners at the broken bridge restaurant - such excellent quality food and superb service. The location is very easy get to ( there is airport drop off and pick up for a fee) This was our third time staying in this facility and we’ve always had a wonderful experience. This is our home away from home. Thank you Somerset greenways staff.

text.text:
Our stay at Somerset Greenways Chennai was truly wonderful. The room was big, bright, clean, and spacious, with excellent amenities—including a washing machine, fridge, and kitchen supplies—that made our 10-day visit incredibly comfortable. We especially enjoyed the beautiful rooftop pool and cabana areas, which offered a peaceful escape from the summer heat and the bustle of the city below.

The hotel staff were exceptionally kind and attentive. Kumar, our breakfast server, went above and beyond to ensure we enjoyed each meal, sharing insights about the food, his culture, and Indian history—an unexpected and memorable highlight of our trip. The rest of the dining team, including kitchen manager Thangam, were also warm and helpful. Subhendo, the fitness trainer, was always available to assist us with the hot tub, steam room, and sauna, enhancing our wellness experience.

We are truly grateful for the hospitality and care we received and hope to return to Somerset in the future.

text.text:
I booked this hotel for two nights expecting a comfortable and professional experience. Unfortunately, it was far from that.

The room had cleanliness issues, service was painfully slow, often taking over an hour despite multiple follow-ups.

A major disappointment was their visitor policy. My close relative, who had dropped us from the airport and was helping with important work discussions, was not allowed in the room — something never mentioned on the website. After he complained about their poor service, reception deliberately referred to him as a “driver,” which felt insulting and unprofessional.

The unprofessionalism extended to the restaurant. My cousin overheard a staff member rudely mocking a guest who had ordered in-room breakfast, making inappropriate comments.

The only positive was the location. Cleanliness was average, service was practically non-existent, and staff behavior was unprofessional and at times disrespectful. For the price charged, I left feeling stressed, disappointed, and cheated. I would not recommend this hotel.

editorialSummary.text: Chic quarters in an upmarket hotel offering a laid-back restaurant, plus a cafe/bar with a terrace.

text.text:
I would gladly award this hotel 5 stars if the food was good but unfortunately the dinner buffet, though it is relatively cheap for hotel residents, was not good.

As food is problematic in the sipcot area I have no choice but reduce one star from the total rating.

The service throughout the property is fantastic.

All members of staff are attentive and go the extra mile to accommodate guest's needs.

I wish to mention Mr. Akhil who I believe is the head receptionist or duty manager and his colleague (he sat at the priority desk at reception) who I forgot his name but was equally courteous and helpful.

There are always members of staff at the lobby who greet guests and offer two types of free drinks (detox water and a sweeter drink that varies from day to day).

Mr. Antoine is always smiling and eager to help.

He speaks Tamil and he patiently assisted me by calling uber drivers as many of them need prompting over the phone before they come (probably because my method of payment was cash).

I used the hotel's transport service twice and was extremely satisfied on both occasions.

The driver on my first trip (around 40 kilometers inland) is called Rajiv Gandhi which is why I remember his name.

The driver on my second drive (to the airport) was also superb but I can not remember his name.

The main problem at the restaurant is there is only one AC unit (placed roughly in the middle of the dining hall).

Not only does it make the dining hall uncomfortably warm it also means the area where the food is cooked is not cool enough for a 5 star hotel.

This problem can be easily remedied by adding an ac unit and having it face the direction of the open kitchen (with the current arrangement the dining hall reminds me of a food court in South Delhi).

The food is aimed mainly at North Indian tastes (probably because many guests are temporary workers and visitors at IT companies and hail from other parts of India) but it lacks authenticity and the desserts are inedible.

In summary I enjoyed staying here much more than my two recent stays at the Novotel OMR but the dinner buffet at the Novotel OMR was markedly tastier.

originalText.text:
I would gladly award this hotel 5 stars if the food was good but unfortunately the dinner buffet, though it is relatively cheap for hotel residents, was not good.

As food is problematic in the sipcot area I have no choice but reduce one star from the total rating.

The service throughout the property is fantastic.

All members of staff are attentive and go the extra mile to accommodate guest's needs.

I wish to mention Mr. Akhil who I believe is the head receptionist or duty manager and his colleague (he sat at the priority desk at reception) who I forgot his name but was equally courteous and helpful.

There are always members of staff at the lobby who greet guests and offer two types of free drinks (detox water and a sweeter drink that varies from day to day).

Mr. Antoine is always smiling and eager to help.

He speaks Tamil and he patiently assisted me by calling uber drivers as many of them need prompting over the phone before they come (probably because my method of payment was cash).

I used the hotel's transport service twice and was extremely satisfied on both occasions.

The driver on my first trip (around 40 kilometers inland) is called Rajiv Gandhi which is why I remember his name.

The driver on my second drive (to the airport) was also superb but I can not remember his name.

The main problem at the restaurant is there is only one AC unit (placed roughly in the middle of the dining hall).

Not only does it make the dining hall uncomfortably warm it also means the area where the food is cooked is not cool enough for a 5 star hotel.

This problem can be easily remedied by adding an ac unit and having it face the direction of the open kitchen (with the current arrangement the dining hall reminds me of a food court in South Delhi).

The food is aimed mainly at North Indian tastes (probably because many guests are temporary workers and visitors at IT companies and hail from other parts of India) but it lacks authenticity and the desserts are inedible.

In summary I enjoyed staying here much more than my two recent stays at the Novotel OMR but the dinner buffet at the Novotel OMR was markedly tastier.

text.text:
I spent a night there with my family. I was taken aback by the 5-star reviews because the hotel is subpar and lacking in a number of amenities, with the exception of the breakfast, which was excellent. The front desk employees are unaware of the reservations made by the guests. I arrived at around 13:30 and was asked to wait in the reception area even though I had paid for a reservation that began at 10:00 am. One of the staff members assisted me get a room after I showed him my reservation.

The receptionists were ineffective, they clustered together and pretended to be busy when there were no customers at the desk.  The reception lobby was packed with students from the nearby college like in a dorm.

The smell of mold was filling the rooms. The central Air conditioner operated erratically and failed to maintain the room temperature. The bathroom was tiny, outdated, and full of broken fixtures. I had to call them to get everything I needed, which is not how a five-star hotel should operate. It's not worth the money I spent.

editorialSummary.text: Upscale property with a 24/7 restaurant, a trendy bar & an outdoor pool, plus a gym & a spa.

text.text:
I booked a room at this hotel through an online website. Just before the booking date, I received a WhatsApp message claiming to be from Raj Park, asking for my bank details. Shockingly, the message contained all my booking information. This means either the data was leaked or hacked. When I called the hotel, they acknowledged being aware of such scams and said their team was working on it. If they knew about this, they should have at least notified guests in advance to ignore such messages, which they failed to do.

Coming to the stay, the first room we were given had a terrible odor, and we had to request a room change. The second room was better, but even there, the bathroom light was fused. By then, we were so disappointed that we didn’t bother asking for another change.

In one word—avoid this hotel. For the same price, you can easily find much better options. Truly disappointing experience.

text.text:
Had a terrible experience at Hotel Raj Park Chennai due to the unprofessional behaviour exhibited by the staff. Staff members seemed uninterested in assisting customers. The reception staff were totally lost when I asked a simple question about the check out timing.

Restaurant staff behaviour was an epitome of unprofessionalism The food was served cold, as though it had just been taken out of the refrigerator. It was clear that it hadn't been properly heated before being plated. I expected a warm, freshly made meal, but instead, I got something that felt like it had been sitting around for far too long. Which when mentioned to the staff they agreed to it without showing any regret.

Key card was not functioning at times, making it difficult to access my room. I had to go back to the front desk each time to get a new card or have it reprogrammed, which became time-consuming and inconvenient. Although the receptionist attended to the issue,  the card was not reprogrammed properly, have to visit reception for the second time due to this issue.

It’s clear that customer satisfaction is not a priority here. I was expecting a much higher level of professionalism. Sadly, I won’t be returning and would not recommend this place to anyone looking for a positive experience.

We hired 2 rooms for 3 nights.

The superior rooms are very good, hotel interiors and ambience is nice, food was great and customer service was excellent. Loved the breakfast buffet!

Minuses

- Smelly towels
- erratic, fluctuating AC
- room intercom phone was not working

We paid over 30k for our 3 day stay  but was charged Rs 500 to replace a lost room key card.

I’ve stayed in many high end hotels and they give a replacement card At no charge.

If the bill is above a certain amount, replacement key should be given free - it’s not a big deal to give one.

editorialSummary.text: Polished quarters in an upmarket hotel with 3 restaurants, a pool & a spa, plus free breakfast.

text.text:
I recently stayed at The Accord Metropolitan in Chennai and had a thoroughly enjoyable experience.

Location:
The hotel is conveniently located right on the main road, adjacent to a flyover, making it easy to access from various parts of the city. Shops, restaurants, and essential stores are all close by, whatever you need is just a short walk away.

Rooms & Amenities:
The rooms are excellent. Even the standard category room is spacious and includes a bathtub, which is a rare offering these days. The room features a 50" TV with OTT platforms already subscribed, a separate coffee table with two chairs, a dedicated work desk with an office chair, and two telephones viz. one near the bed and the other at the work desk.

The hotel provides all essential toiletries and accessories, along with thoughtful amenities like a bathrobe, slippers, iron with ironing board, hairdryer, and a mini bar. Everything is well maintained and neatly arranged.

Dining:
The property houses three restaurants. I tried the breakfast buffet and was amazed by the variety, so many options that I couldn't try everything even over a three-day stay! Each dish I tried was delicious and well-prepared.

On our first evening, we dined at OPM, one of the in-house restaurants. The service was prompt, and the staff was courteous. The food was excellent — especially the honey-glazed lotus stem starter, which was a unique and memorable dish for me. The ambience was elevated by live singing and soft music, creating a very pleasant dining experience.

The following evening, we visited the restaurant on the first floor. While the food was fine, the loud sound didn’t suit our mood, so we didn’t stay long.

Facilities:
I used the gym and swimming pool, which were well-maintained. I couldn’t try the spa, sauna, or steam room this time — but those are definitely on my list for the next visit.

Final Thoughts:
Overall, The Accord Metropolitan offers a great blend of location, comfort, service, and dining. I highly recommend it for both business and leisure travelers.

Thanks for reading! Feel free to check out the photos and do like and follow for more reviews.

text.text: The hotel is nice and well situated. The staff are attentive and are eager to please, but can be a little slow sometimes. The rooms were of a good size and were maintained well. I did have to call housekeeping 3 times to clear up mess left by the previous tenant, but this may have been down to the language barrier as I feel they did not understand. Breakfasts were good where Paul and Randeep (the waiters) were very attentive. The gym was small but well maintained and sufficient for a good workout. The swimming pool looked good but nowhere did it state you have to take a towel from the room. There are also no changing rooms other than the toilets adjacent to the pool which were not ideal. All round ok hotel and would reuse

editorialSummary.text: Modern quarters in a contemporary hotel with dining options & a bar, plus 2 pools & a spa.

text.text:
We arrived in Chennai in March 2025 and had a very enjoyable stay in this hotel. Service was excellent. Many options for food and drinks as they had about three restaurants within. Breakfast and dinner spread was so varied and widespread; great choices for non vegetarians (their mutton curry with thosai was amazing ) that which we did not enjoy in other hotels that we stayed on our two week trip to Trichy, Pondicherry, Goa and Cochin. Chennai GRT outdid even the Taj Fort Aquada in Goa by leaps and bounds in every aspect; service, ambience, rooms, fast lifts, food and driver’s parking.
As for service we wish to mention:
Kathir , Restaurant Manager & Sathish, Senior Executive, who were ever so attentive to both my husband every time  we were in the restaurant for our meals. My husband, who is English, wasn’t familiar with the various Indian dishes and had his preferences but they were so caring and ensured his every request was catered to. It is senior management such as them who enhance the experience for us customers and keep us coming back.
We want to thank Aparajita, Reception Staff who checked us in so smoothly and gave a few gift cards to enjoy in the hotel. Aparajita even walked us to the room to ensure it met with our comfort.She was very engaging, soft spoken, charming and stopped to check on us any time she met us in the foyer.
All in all we hardly had any meals outside of this hotel as hygiene was our priority and GRT, Chennai met that. If we visit Chennai again, this definitely be where we will stay!

Chandrika & Peter Nelson from Malaysia.

This 5 star hotel is located on the main road and it is easy to find the place. They have well trained staff who will guide you from parking to other services in the hotel.
I have visited this place for the conference and the banquet hall is big and can accommodate 100-150 people . There is good space and the refreshment as sugarcane juice is served. The water bottles were placed on each table . The food is served near the banquet hall and they have a good variety of vegetarian dishes in the buffet and 2-3 items in non vegetarian. The food is good and the staff were on their toes to serve the same .
The dessert counter is also good.
Overall a good place to attend a conference and have dinner.

Our stay at Grand Chennai by GRT Hotels was nothing short of exceptional.
From the moment we arrived until the moment we left, everything exceeded our expectations.

The staff were truly outstanding – warm, professional, and always ready to help with a smile. They made us feel genuinely welcome, like we were part of a family.
The cleanliness was impeccable. Every corner of the hotel was spotless and fresh.
The food was simply amazing – flavorful, varied, and beautifully presented. Every meal was a delight!

What truly touched our hearts was how attached our children became to the place.
When we told them it was time to leave, they were genuinely sad – they didn’t want to go! That says more than words ever could about how special this hotel is.

Thank you to everyone at Grand Chennai by GRT Hotels for creating such a beautiful experience.
You’ve raised the bar for hospitality, and we look forward to returning again, God willing.

With heartfelt gratitude,
Jamal & Family

text.text:
MGM Resort is an absolutely beautiful place to stay! The entire property is spacious and well-designed, offering a sense of luxury and comfort from the moment you arrive. The rooms are clean, well-maintained, and many come with a stunning view that truly adds to the experience.

There are plenty of games and entertainment options in the resort, so there’s never a dull moment for children . Inside restaurants and bars are serving delicious food and drinks . The private beach is perfect for soaking up the sun or enjoying a peaceful walk.

The lush lawn areas are great for relaxing or even having a small picnic, and everything is so well-kept and inviting. It’s clear that a lot of thought and care goes into maintaining the entire resort.

Everything about MGM Resort is just so good .Highly recommended for a getaway with friends, family, or even solo. You won’t be disappointed!

editorialSummary.text: Posh rooms in a contemporary hotel with 3 restaurants & 2 bars, plus an outdoor pool & a spa.

text.text:
We had about 60 guests staying at The Savera Hotel for my wedding on August 29, 2025 (the wedding was at New Woodlands Hotel next door). From the beginning to the end, the experience was seamless and stress-free for all of us.

A special mention goes to Ms. Patricia, the reservations manager, who handled everything with such professionalism and warmth. She ensured that the check-in and check-out process for a large group was smooth and efficient, which really took a huge load off our shoulders during such a busy time. Our guests felt very well taken care of and had a wonderful stay.

The hospitality, coordination, and service truly exceeded expectations. Highly recommend Savera for anyone looking for a reliable and guest-friendly stay in Chennai—and a big thank you again to Ms. Patricia for making it all so effortless!

😡 Worst hotel experience ever.
The entire place reeks of smoke and rot — every single room feels filthy. The first room they gave me had a broken TV and the AC didn’t work. They only sent someone to fix it around 10 PM. The next morning, when I was rushing to get ready for an appointment, the shower knob broke. I had just 30 minutes before I had to leave, yet no one came for 15 minutes despite repeated calls. After half an hour they finally moved me to another room. No apology, no courtesy check, nothing.

When I mentioned this to the front desk lady, she completely dismissed me and said it wasn’t her job, pointing me to someone else. Absolutely zero customer service.

If you value your time, money, and basic comfort — avoid this place at all costs. It’s shocking this place is even still listed.

text.text:
Hotel Savera, a well-established name in Chennai, offers a stay that is often described as a mix of old-world charm and modern convenience. Many guests appreciate the hotel's central and accessible location in Mylapore, which makes it easy to explore the city's key attractions. The staff is consistently praised for being courteous, polite, and helpful, contributing to a pleasant guest experience.
The hotel's dining options are a highlight for many visitors, with multiple restaurants serving a variety of cuisines, including authentic South Indian and other Asian dishes. The breakfast buffet, in particular, receives frequent positive mentions for its quality and variety.
However, some recent reviews have noted that the hotel's age is starting to show. While the hospitality is consistently good, there have been occasional comments about the need for room renovations and better maintenance. Despite these minor criticisms, Savera remains a popular choice for both business and leisure travelers seeking a comfortable and well-located hotel in Chennai.

Worth the stay if you can bare extremely cold temperatures and go about your day without a decent cup of coffee.
The ambience and location of the hotel is good.
However we have faced difficulties in the room quality. The thermostat is broken in both the rooms we booked. Upon speaking to the staff, they were only able to reduce the vent size to resolve the unbearable conditions in the room. There was no solution for the broken thermostat. We will have to call the team to open the vent further if we feel hot now. No room change was allowed.
Moreover, for a daily coffee drinker, the coffee machine at breakfast is poorly maintained resulting in a burnt taste. Due to this i have to resort to other means.

text.text:
I had a pleasant stay at Park Plaza Chennai OMR, perfectly located in the heart of Chennai’s IT Corridor, just a short drive from Elliot’s Beach and 14 km from Chennai International Airport. The rooms were spacious, modern, and spotlessly clean, with floor-to-ceiling windows, free Wi-Fi, and a comfy bed. The staff were incredibly polite and proactive—special shoutout to Vinothini from housekeeping for her warm and efficient service. The breakfast buffet at Oasis was impressive, with a mix of Indian and continental options, though a bit more variety in North Indian dishes would be great.

The only drawbacks were minor maintenance issues in the bathroom, like a slow-draining sink, and the parking experience could be improved, as I had trouble getting assistance with luggage. The pool and fitness center were well-maintained, adding to the overall comfort. Great value for money and ideal for business travelers or those exploring Chennai. Would definitely return.

I recently stayed at Four Points by Sheraton and had a truly comfortable and pleasant experience. The hotel maintains excellent cleanliness standards, and the staff was courteous, helpful, and very professional throughout our stay.

The room was spacious, well-equipped, and had a modern design with all the expected amenities — including a comfortable bed, fast Wi-Fi, and a clean bathroom. The food at the in-house restaurant was delicious, especially the breakfast buffet which had a wide range of options catering to both Indian and international tastes.

The location is very convenient, with easy access to the airport and major city attractions. Their airport pickup and drop service was punctual and smooth.

Overall, I highly recommend Four Points by Sheraton for both business and leisure travelers looking for a blend of comfort, service, and value.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Citadines, and my overall experience was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment I stepped into the hotel, I was struck by the elegant lobby, which exudes warmth and sophistication. The check-in process was smooth and efficient, and the staff’s welcoming demeanor immediately made me feel at home.

The rooms were another highlight of my stay—spacious, well-maintained, and thoughtfully designed. Every detail, from the comfortable bedding to the modern amenities, was curated to ensure a relaxing and comfortable experience. The cleanliness and upkeep of the rooms were impeccable, adding to the overall charm of the stay.

The restaurant, especially during breakfast, was a standout experience. The vibrant ambiance, immaculate cleanliness, and inviting atmosphere set the perfect tone for the day. The breakfast spread was impressive, featuring a wide variety of dishes to cater to every taste. Whether it was the freshly baked pastries, the assortment of cereals, the selection of seasonal fruits, or the hot dishes showcasing both local and international flavors, everything was prepared with great care and attention to detail. Each bite reflected a commitment to quality and excellence.

What truly elevated the experience, however, was the outstanding service provided by the Food and Beverage team, led by the Head of Food and Beverage (Not able to remember his name) His genuine warmth, attention to detail, and dedication to guest satisfaction were evident throughout my stay. While I regret not remembering his name, his efforts to personally ensure every guest felt valued and well taken care of were remarkable. He took the time to check in with guests, making sure all F&B offerings were not just available but served promptly and with care.

The entire F&B team went above and beyond to accommodate individual preferences and dietary needs, adding a personalized touch to the dining experience. Their ability to maintain such high standards of service, even during the busy breakfast hours, was truly commendable and added a memorable layer to my stay.

In summary, Hotel Citadines offers a perfect blend of comfort, exceptional service, and culinary excellence. From the welcoming lobby and well-appointed rooms to the delightful breakfast experience, every aspect of the stay was carefully curated to ensure a memorable visit. I highly recommend Hotel Citadines to anyone looking for a stay where hospitality and attention to detail are truly prioritized.

Excellent Stay at Citadines !
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Citadines, a City view property, and I must say that it was an exceptional experience!

*Highlights:*

- *Staff:* The staff were incredibly friendly, approachable, and provided top-notch service. They went above and beyond to ensure my stay was comfortable and enjoyable.
- *Parking:* The parking facilities were convenient and well-maintained.

- *Food Pricing:* While the food was good, I found it to be a bit pricey. Consider offering more competitive pricing or promotions to make it more accessible to guests.
- *Room Pricing:* Similarly, the room rates were slightly higher than expected. However, considering the exceptional service and amenities, I felt it was worth the investment.

*Overall Experience:*
Despite the minor pricing concerns at restarants, my stay was truly exceptional. The staff and amenities all combined to create a memorable experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

*Rating:*
- *Cleanliness:* 5/5
- *Service:* 5/5
- *Amenities:* 5/5
- *Value:* 4/5 (due to pricing concerns)

Thank you to the entire team at Citadine for a wonderful stay! I look forward to returning in the future.

text.text:
Somerset Green Ways Hotel: A Serene Retreat

Nestled amidst lush greenery, Somerset Green Ways Hotel offers a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. Situated in the heart of Chennai City, this hotel boasts breathtaking views that captivate the senses and rejuvenate the soul.

One of the most striking features of Somerset Green Ways Hotel is its picturesque surroundings. Surrounded by verdant water body, iconic palace and verdant landscapes, guests are treated to panoramic views that unfold from the hotel terrace. Whether you're enjoying a morning cup of coffee or unwinding after a day of exploration, the vistas offered by this hotel are nothing short of spectacular.

Moreover, the hotel's strategic location ensures that guests can immerse themselves in nature's beauty without compromising on accessibility. While secluded enough to offer a sense of serenity, Somerset Green Ways Hotel is also conveniently located near popular tourist attractions, allowing guests to easily explore the wonders of the city.

Furthermore, the hotel's design maximizes its natural surroundings, seamlessly blending indoor and outdoor spaces to offer guests an immersive experience. Whether lounging by the poolside, dining al fresco, or simply strolling through the landscaped gardens, guests are constantly surrounded by the beauty of nature.

Additionally, Somerset Green Ways Hotel offers a range of activities that allow guests to further immerse themselves in the natural splendor of the region. There are plenty of opportunities to explore and appreciate the biodiversity of Somerset. You can enjoy by the pool or go for a cross fit work out or party at the famous radio room

In conclusion, Somerset Green Ways Hotel is more than just a place to stay – it's a sanctuary for nature lovers seeking solace and serenity. With its breathtaking views, seamless integration with nature, and range of outdoor activities, it promises an unforgettable retreat for all who visit.

text.text:
Ok, My Review will be based on my experience and I would be rating the review on few points.

1) The location - It's in DrNair Road, Close to 1.5km from Pondy Bazar and AGS Tnagar theatre is 500ms from the place, so the location is prime - no complaints at all.
If you are coming by Bus - From Central you need to get down at Broadway and catch the 11 series bus to TNagar.

2) Checkin Process - There was delay due to the crowd but the receptionists did their best to make sure everyone had a good experience.

3)Room - I got a room in the 8th floor, executive room - the room overall was quite good with classy interiors and good enough space for a wed,sofa and a office chair as well - Two bottles of water along with complimentary snacks served.

3) Room Service - Pathetic, I ordered some snacks and it took 30 mins to arrive, this is not what we expect from this hotel.

4) Buffet Breakfast - If you are someone who loves a lavish spread of many items, you will be disappointed.
If you compare this spread with say GrT hotel then this spread of choices is way less.
For me was adequate and the taste was okay, nothing great.

Overall quite an okay stay but the team need a to work on the room service and the buffet breakfast spread part.

Will I visit again - maybe but the current price of 6.5k is way way too high for the service.

text.text:
Review of The Residency Hotel, 49 G N Chetty Road T Nagar, Chennai.

My name is Devadaas, and I have been staying at The Residency Hotel in T Nagar, Chennai, for the past 15 years during my annual visits to India. My most recent stay was at the end of August 2024.

I would like to take a moment to share my experience with the hotel. The rooms are exceptionally comfortable, and the housekeeping is top-notch. The customer service is outstanding, and I always feel safe and well-cared for during my stays.

I would particularly like to express my heartfelt thanks to one individual, Mr. Mathavan. His kindness, helpfulness, and down-to-earth nature have made a lasting impression on me. He goes above and beyond to assist with any questions I have, and his dedication truly stands out.

I highly recommend The Residency Hotel for anyone looking for an exceptional stay in Chennai.

text.text:
Even after four days of departing, the exceptional service, delicious cuisine, and remarkable professionalism of this hotel remain vivid in my memory.

Nestled away from the main road, the hotel offers a tranquil retreat, free from the noise of traffic and horns—a feature I truly appreciated. During my stay, I had the pleasure of meeting Mr. Parthipan, the Manager. His responsiveness to feedback was astounding; one of my suggestions was implemented across all rooms in less than 24 hours! When I experienced WiFi issues, he promptly provided a dongle, exceeding my expectations of simply logging a complaint for the IT team.

The food at the hotel was a gastronomic delight, offering the finest quality and flavour. I invited a friend to the dinner buffet, and he was equally impressed. A connoisseur who often dines at one of India's most prestigious five-star hotels, he praised the freshness and exquisite taste of the fish, noting it surpassed that of his usual five-star venue. Also, he said that the fish at the five-star hotel was frozen whereas at Accord it was fresh produce. This high standard is credited to Mr. Venkatesh Bhat, CEO, who personally trains the restaurant staff weekly and conducts surprise quality checks, ensuring the kitchen maintains its top-notch standards.

I also met Naveen, the Executive Chef, whose humility and dedication to teamwork were inspiring. He attributed the culinary excellence to his hardworking team, reflecting the hotel's commitment to professional, collaborative service.

Remarkably, this hotel delivers five-star service and culinary experiences at three-star prices. The buffet is reasonably priced, with an extensive selection for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians.

I find it perplexing that some guests have given one-star ratings and complained about the food—perhaps their taste buds are off!

On my next visit to India, even without any specific plans in Chennai, I will make it a point to stay at this hotel again, solely to relive its extraordinary hospitality and exceptional dining.

We hired 2 rooms for 3 nights.

The superior rooms are very good, hotel interiors and ambience is nice, food was great and customer service was excellent. Loved the breakfast buffet!

Minuses

- Smelly towels
- erratic, fluctuating AC
- room intercom phone was not working

We paid over 30k for our 3 day stay  but was charged Rs 500 to replace a lost room key card.

I’ve stayed in many high end hotels and they give a replacement card At no charge.

If the bill is above a certain amount, replacement key should be given free - it’s not a big deal to give one.

text.text:
My experience at The Accord Metropolitan was nothing short of exceptional, both in terms of meetings and stay. From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I was greeted with warmth and professionalism that set the tone for the rest of my visit.

Firstly, the meeting facilities exceeded my expectations (Little carpet smell). The hotel offers state-of-the-art meeting rooms equipped with all the necessary amenities for a successful business gathering. The staff was incredibly attentive, ensuring that every detail was taken care of, allowing us to focus solely on our agenda. The seamless coordination and impeccable service truly made our meetings productive and enjoyable.

Now, onto the stay experience – it was simply outstanding. The rooms were spacious, elegantly furnished, and provided a serene retreat after a long day of meetings. The attention to detail was evident in every aspect of the room, from the plush bedding to the modern amenities. The housekeeping staff maintained impeccable cleanliness throughout my stay, ensuring a comfortable and hygienic environment.

And let's talk about the highlight of my culinary experience – the mutton biryani. Oh, it was nothing short of a gastronomic delight! The flavors were perfectly balanced, the meat tender, and the aroma tantalizing. It's no wonder that it's a special mention – a dish that truly deserves all the praise it receives.

Overall, my time at The Accord Metropolitan was beyond exceptional. The combination of top-notch meeting facilities, luxurious accommodation, and mouthwatering cuisine makes it a standout choice for both business and leisure travelers alike. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and look forward to my next visit.

text.text:
I have been traveling to Chennai since 2011, and over the years, I have grown to love this vibrant city, not just for its rich culture but especially for its kind-hearted people and the warm, welcoming hospitality that truly sets it apart. Among the many wonderful places to stay, Accord Metropolitan has become my favorite for the past year, and it has been an exceptional experience every single time.

This hotel has a unique way of making you feel completely at home, blending comfort, care, and impeccable service. The smallest details are taken care of with great attention and thoughtfulness. I am especially grateful to Charles and his team for the early morning breakfasts that always start my day on a positive note. A special mention also goes to Mr. Katyal and his dedicated team, who consistently go above and beyond to ensure everything is perfect, never missing an opportunity to assist and make you feel valued.

If you're visiting Chennai and are looking for a place that pampers you just like home, Accord Metropolitan is undoubtedly the place to be. Their warmth, professionalism, and personal touch make every stay truly memorable. Thank you to the entire team for making my visits so delightful!

text.text:
Exceptional Hospitality and Culinary Delights – A Truly World-Class Experience

From the moment I arrived at the Trident Hotel Chennai, I was greeted with a welcome that was nothing short of world-class. The front-of-house team didn’t just extend a friendly greeting—they truly took an interest in me, making me feel like more than just a guest. Their warm smiles, gracious care, and delightful sense of humor set the tone for an exceptional stay.

A highlight of my experience was the incredible culinary artistry led by Head Chef Chris and his talented team. Dining here is not just about food—it’s an experience. As someone who eats with their eyes first, I was immediately captivated by the presentation and vibrant colors of every dish. The highlight? A surprising taste sensation involving what I thought was a cherry but turned out to be a chilli!!

After complimenting Chris on the extraordinary quality of the food, he graciously prepared his favorite special chicken curry dish just for me. The flavors were nothing short of spectacular—truly a masterpiece.

Hey Friends, visited Chennai recently for my official trip, where got to stay at Trident Chennai, so the moment i landed at Chennai airport my phone beeped with a message from the hotel stating the Driver and Car details, immediately i came out from the terminal guy was waiting there along with a plague card which was interesting, then a black colour Innova which looks like a Luxury car since as well maintained picks me up, the moment i step into the car Mr Driver offered me with Cold drinking water bottles.
As soon as i reached the hotel the check-in process was very smooth, the room was neat and clean, with all the luxury amenities, Dinner and Breakfast were amazingly prepared and served.
They surprised me with a welcome message from their General Manager which came after switching on the television 😀 The check-out process was smooth as well Ms Laxmi was very helpful and courteous during the entire process.
Overall It was a memorable experience at Hotel Trident Chennai.

text.text: Grand GRT consistently delivers a top-notch experience that truly embodies what a 5-star hotel should be. From the moment you step inside, you’re greeted with impeccable service, luxurious amenities, and an atmosphere of grandeur. Whether it’s the immaculate rooms, the attentive staff, or the overall attention to detail, Grand GRT goes above and beyond to ensure every guest’s comfort and satisfaction. It’s a place where you feel pampered and valued. The consistency of their excellence is a testament to their commitment to maintaining the highest standards. I’ve had numerous stays here, and they have never fallen short in making me feel like a valued guest. Keep up the outstanding work, Grand GRT, because you set a benchmark for what a 5-star experience should be.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Grand Chennai by GRT Hotels, and it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The location in the heart of T Nagar makes it perfect for shopping enthusiasts and those looking to explore the city.

The hospitality stood out the most—each staff member went above and beyond to ensure we felt welcomed and taken care of. The rooms were impeccably clean, spacious, and thoughtfully designed with modern amenities, making the stay comfortable and luxurious.

The highlight of my visit was the dining experience. The buffet offered a delectable spread of Indian and international dishes, and the chefs were kind enough to customize dishes to suit our preferences. Their attention to detail and emphasis on quality were evident in every bite.

The overall ambiance of the hotel reflects a blend of elegance and warmth that makes it a perfect destination for both leisure and business travelers. Grand Chennai by GRT truly sets a benchmark in hospitality, and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Chennai. Looking forward to another memorable stay!

text.text: I had a remarkable three-night stay at Grand Chennai by GRT. The rooms were luxuriously spacious and impeccably clean, with thoughtful features enhancing the overall comfort. The complimentary breakfast buffet was a culinary delight, offering a diverse menu that catered to both South Indian and Western tastes. Special mention to Mr. Sridhar at the travel desk, whose exceptional assistance during a storm ensured our safety and a seamless extension of our stay. Despite citywide power cuts, the hotel maintained an uninterrupted power supply, showcasing their commitment to guest well-being. The housekeeping by Mr. Rajaguru and overseen by Mr. Senthil, excelled in maintaining a pristine environment. Dining at Jai Hind restaurant was a highlight, with the à la carte menu providing a convenient and delicious culinary experience. Overall, the fantastic service and attention to detail by the staff, especially Mr. Sridhar, Mr. Rajaguru, and Mr. Senthil, made our stay memorable. Grand Chennai by GRT is highly recommended for those seeking a top-notch 5-star experience in Chennai.

text.text:
Great place to stay. This is our third stay here. Very hospitable staff, extremely friendly, each one of the hotel staff put customer service as their North Pole. Besides the service, their room, food, amentare all world class. We would like to give a shout out to each one of the hotel employees with whom we crossed path but that list will be too long. Nevertheless we want to call out these hotel staff for exceptional service and customer satisfaction first attitude.

From room service: Dhakshina Murthy & Sornam
From Concierge: Johnson, Sridhar & Gopi
From ground transportation: Sasi Kumar & Magesh
From in-room dining: Gracy, Sayeed & Ravi
Chef: Ganesh

These folks treated us like family and we will go back and stay there again next time.

text.text:
Ramada Egmore is close to the station on the main road at the crossing, finding different modes of transport is not of any hassle.
The hotel lobby is spacious with ample sitting area, I had booked myself in an executive room, the room was very spacious with all the required amenities you find in hotel with a lounger and table apart from the work table. The room had a city view of the adjoining areas, I felt the room should have been lit in a better manner atleast towards the wardrobe side. I visited the sauna when I checked in towards the morning but couldn't find any attendent there. The buffet breakfast was at the restaurant which was a reasonable spread.
It is not a new property and without much frills but good enough for a night stay especially if you choose to stay closer to the railway station. The staff was courteous and housekeeping was reasonable. From my overall experience I would rate it 3.75 on a scale of 5

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Ramada by Wyndham Chennai Egmore, and I must say, it exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I was greeted with warm smiles and excellent service. The staff went above and beyond to ensure that my stay was comfortable and enjoyable.

The rooms at the hotel were spacious, clean, and beautifully decorated. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and I had a great night’s sleep every night. The amenities provided in the room were top-notch, including a flat-screen TV, a mini-fridge, and a coffee maker.

The hotel’s location is also a major plus. It is conveniently situated in the heart of Chennai, making it easy to explore the city’s attractions. Additionally, the hotel provides a shuttle service, which was incredibly convenient for getting around.

One of the highlights of my stay was the dining experience at the hotel’s restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious, with a wide variety of options to choose from. The staff at the restaurant were attentive and friendly, making sure that every meal was a memorable one.

Overall, I highly recommend Hotel Ramada by Wyndham Chennai Egmore to anyone visiting Chennai. The combination of excellent service, comfortable rooms, and convenient location make it the perfect choice for both business and leisure travelers. I can’t wait to visit again!

text.text:
Ramada Chennai is a renowned hotel located in the bustling city of Chennai, Tamil Nadu. Situated in the upscale Guindy neighborhood, this hotel offers a blend of comfort, convenience, and warm hospitality to its guests.

Upon entering Ramada Chennai, you are greeted by a stylish and contemporary ambiance. The hotel's modern architecture and tastefully designed interiors create a welcoming atmosphere. The lobby is spacious and elegantly furnished, reflecting the hotel's commitment to providing a comfortable and relaxing environment.

Ramada Chennai boasts a range of well-appointed rooms and suites that cater to the needs of both business and leisure travelers. The accommodations are tastefully decorated and equipped with modern amenities, ensuring a comfortable stay. From plush beds to spacious bathrooms and convenient workspaces, every aspect of the rooms is thoughtfully designed to meet the needs of discerning guests.

The hotel offers a variety of dining options to satisfy every palate. It features a multi-cuisine restaurant where you can indulge in a culinary journey with a wide selection of delectable dishes. The restaurant's skilled chefs prepare an array of flavorsome delicacies, offering a delightful dining experience.

Ramada Chennai also provides state-of-the-art facilities for business travelers. It features well-equipped meeting and conference rooms, making it an ideal venue for corporate events and gatherings. The hotel's professional staff is dedicated to ensuring that every event is a success, providing assistance and support as needed.

For relaxation and rejuvenation, guests can make use of the hotel's fitness center and swimming pool. These facilities offer opportunities to maintain a fitness routine or unwind after a busy day of exploring the city.

The hotel's prime location in Guindy provides easy access to popular attractions, shopping centers, and business districts in Chennai. It is well-connected to the airport and major transportation hubs, making it a convenient choice for travelers.

In conclusion, Ramada Chennai offers a comfortable and convenient stay for guests visiting the city. With its well-appointed accommodations, delightful dining options, and modern amenities, the hotel aims to provide a memorable experience for both business and leisure travelers. Whether you're visiting Chennai for business or leisure, Ramada Chennai is an excellent choice for a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

MGM Resort is an absolutely beautiful place to stay! The entire property is spacious and well-designed, offering a sense of luxury and comfort from the moment you arrive. The rooms are clean, well-maintained, and many come with a stunning view that truly adds to the experience.

There are plenty of games and entertainment options in the resort, so there’s never a dull moment for children . Inside restaurants and bars are serving delicious food and drinks . The private beach is perfect for soaking up the sun or enjoying a peaceful walk.

The lush lawn areas are great for relaxing or even having a small picnic, and everything is so well-kept and inviting. It’s clear that a lot of thought and care goes into maintaining the entire resort.

Everything about MGM Resort is just so good .Highly recommended for a getaway with friends, family, or even solo. You won’t be disappointed!

text.text:
We booked this resort by chance. Overall, the experience was decent: the rooms were clean and housekeeping was regular, the food at the restaurant was acceptable, and the staff provided solid 4-star service.
The spa was okay, but the facilities and interiors are quite old and worn out. One of the main downsides is the outdated condition of the rooms, which makes the price feel significantly overpriced.
But the biggest drawback is the almost complete lack of a beach area — quite disappointing for a resort located right on the seafront.

text.text:
“A Memorable Stay at Savera Hotel, Chennai!”
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

We recently stayed at the Savera Hotel in Chennai, for about three weeks from 3rd December to 24th December and it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. Located in the heart of the city, this iconic hotel offers the perfect blend of comfort, luxury, and outstanding hospitality.

The rooms were spacious, impeccably clean, and tastefully designed with modern amenities. The bed was incredibly comfortable, ensuring a restful night’s sleep. The views from our room were spectacular, offering a glimpse of Chennai’s vibrant skyline.

The hotel boasts a variety of dining options, and each restaurant exceeded my expectations. The breakfast buffet was a highlight, with an impressive spread of South Indian delicacies, continental dishes, and fresh juices. Special mention to the courteous staff who ensured every meal was a delightful experience.

What truly stood out was the staff’s attentiveness and professionalism. They went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable, from the seamless check-in process to their readiness to assist with every request.

Whether you’re traveling for business or leisure, Savera Hotel is a fantastic choice. Its central location, luxurious accommodations, and exceptional service make it one of Chennai’s best hotels. We can’t wait to return on our next visit to the city!
Special shout out to Mr Lawrence with the guest services who was always making sure that we were comfortable. Bell desk staff Azam ,Prakash and at the reception Jagadeesh and Anbu and Swaralipi and not forgetting the people at the reservation Mr. Leo and Teja. They were all just wonderful. Amazing stay. Thank you all !!!

text.text:
Turyaa Chennai offers an outstanding experience, especially for team lunches and business gatherings. The ambience is elegant and welcoming, with a modern touch and soothing music that sets a relaxing mood for guests. The hotel is well-maintained, with spacious, clean rooms and excellent amenities like a rooftop swimming pool, gym, and spa, making it ideal for both work and leisure visits.

During our recent team lunch at SVAR Restaurant, we were impressed by the wide variety of dishes available in their buffet. The spread included both international and Indian favorites, catering to all tastes. The food quality was top-notch—fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The desserts, especially the brownie with vanilla ice cream, were a highlight for everyone.
The service was exceptional throughout our visit. The staff was attentive, courteous, and ensured that our team felt comfortable and well taken care of. Special thanks to the restaurant team for their prompt service and warm hospitality, which made our lunch truly memorable.

Overall, Turyaa Chennai and SVAR Restaurant are highly recommended for their excellent food, beautiful ambience, and world-class amenities. Whether for a corporate lunch or a family outing, you can expect a delightful and satisfying experience here.

text.text:
My 3-month stay at Bloom Hub Guindy was an unexpectedly delightful experience. The hotel's modern and well-maintained rooms, coupled with the exceptional service provided by the dedicated staff, created a truly comfortable and enjoyable living environment.

Special commend to the housekeeping staff, Ramesh and Vishnu, and their team leader Subash for their impeccable service.

The food and beverages Manager Vijay Anderson & staff Momitta, Chaidal, Bibek, Karan, Ratika & Hrita were excellent in their roles, ensuring a smooth dining experience. Especially Momitta and Chaidali, were always friendly and efficient, anticipating my needs and delivering food on time. Bibek was also excellent at room service, ensuring prompt and reliable delivery.

Chef Raj's signature beetroot yogurt was truly a culinary delight, a standout dish among the many delicious options available.

I also want to acknowledge the helpfulness of the General Manager, Abdul Hakeem who was always available to assist with any issues or concerns. Their timely responses and proactive approach ensured a smooth and stress-free stay.

The hotel's convenient location near the Little Mount metro station added to its appeal, providing easy access to various parts of the city.

While there were occasional minor inconveniences like lift issues or construction noise, these were overshadowed by the overall positive experience.

I felt incredibly safe stay. Despite the lower occupancy during Diwali, I felt secure and well-protected staying alone in a single room. The staff was attentive and the hotel's security measures were reassuring.

Bloom Hub Guindy successfully transformed my extended stay into a comfortable and hassle-free period.

If you're looking for a hotel in Chennai that offers a pleasant and safe stay, I wholeheartedly recommend Bloom Hub Guindy.

text.text:
My experience at Blooms Hub was exceptional. The combination of friendly service, comfortable accommodations, and excellent amenities made for a memorable stay.

The location of the hotel was also perfect for exploring the city. It was conveniently close to the Little mount metro station, making it easy to get around.

One of the highlights was definitely the breakfast buffet. There was a wide array of delicious options to choose from, the food was fresh and beautifully presented, and the service was impeccable.

I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chennai and look forward to returning in the future!
